cons: I can't think of anything I didn't like about tutoring with the Physics department.

review_title: Great staff, not so great management/pay
job_title: ASCTech Computer Systems Manager in Columbus, OH
pros:
The staff you work with are some of the most laid back, kind people you'll meet.
Good work/life balance if you set boundaries.
Getting to work at THE Ohio State University
cons:
Management overpromises and doesn't deliver.
Low pay, even for state employee standards. Raises non-existent.
Benefits aren't as great as they were in the past.

pros: Days off and holidays plentiful
cons: Bad communication, management is uncaring and exists in a vacuum apart from upper management. Puts employees in unsafe situations during pandemic and forces them to sign a pledge recognizing the danger and their willingness to work in it on penalty of never being able to work from home if conditions worsen

pros: Very flexible and great staff
cons: internal promotion, hard to get hire from the outside. Jobs on the posting board are their for formality, they already have someone in mind.

review_title: I loved what I did and was very passionate about my time there.
pros: Great flexibility, the coworkers for very friendly and intelligent. I would definitely recommend this job to someone else.
cons: I didn't like the hours because they didn't fit my class schedule. I still loved what I fit for the most part.

pros: The managers were really nice, the working schedule was relaxing and you can make a lot of friends there. You also got trained before you start working
cons: Sometimes they would put you in the dishroom for many shifts. You may get tired if you have a lot of hw to do.

review_title: Review of job as Student Assistant at the Human Nutrition Office at The Ohio State University
pros: Work is very relaxed, medium paced. Get to meet a lot of faculty and students. Its on campus, so dont need to travel a lot
cons: Sometimes work can be tiring. Changing posters and banners and setting up/tearing down for events occassionally

review_title: Student job but helped me get good internships
pros: If you are student, then it is very easy to work there since it is close to most classes. They are very flexible with student employees because they understand that they have classes.
cons: Doesn't pay well as working at a restaurant near campus, but here you get real experience.

pros: There are many benefits of working at a college or university. Also, there are endless opportunities to learn a variety professional skills by working at different departments.
cons: Parking and traffic in the main campus. It is not easy to leave campus and return for an appointment. Although, there are projects to address this issue.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: good health care, reasonable work expectations, livable wage, travel subsidy for conferences
cons: expensive health care if not subsidized, hard to support a family on stipend, budgets are tightening

job_title: TeleForm Systems Specialist in Columbus, OH
pros: Great benefits and amazing growth opportunities for those looking to go back to school. No place with energy and experience like OSU.
cons: Compensation isn't great but that's why the benefits are awesome. Traffic and parking can be a pain at times.

job_title: Ticket Sales Representative in Columbus, OH
pros: Get to work in sports, flexible learning environment, flexible hours. Most of the work is simple and relatively easy to learn on the first day.
cons: Events are constantly changing, learn from "getting fed from the hose". Here you will need to learn how to deal with all sorts of customers in a professional manner.

job_title: Senior Systems Manager/Senior Project Manager in Dublin, OH
pros: Great education benefit.  Good networking.
cons: Lots of politics, difficult to move up beyond the Manager/Director level.

pros: Great people and comfortable work environment. They are always looking to improve and they usually promote internally, so there are plenty of chances to move up if you stick around.
cons: Certain departments cannot pay well and are understaffed. This can make simple jobs difficult to accomplish, and many entry level jobs are not at competitive wages.

review_title: Growing Institution with lots of oportunity
job_title: Senior Research Scientist in Columbus, OH
pros:
Great environment, descent size city and great opportunities for growth especially in the agricultural, food, nutrition and health related disciplines. The university supports faculty and researchers.
Benefits overall are good, great 401K match and paid vacation time.
cons: Health coverage is not the best compared to other institutions I have worked for

pros: Campus culture is typically positive, generally people are cheery. Review process and assessments are clear and concise.
cons: Large organizations like Ohio State are ultimately concerned about their bottom line. You are a cog in a vast machine and sometimes it does feel that way.

pros:
meet wonderful people
interesting opportunities to interact with faculty
helped in providing some sense of leadership skills
cons:
favoritism is evident in some staffs
there is very little help provide to some staff members 
training was also highly lacking and emphasis was placed on strictly lgbtq+ issues without any regard for mental health, race, and issues related to diversity

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: The pros of being a graduate student are that the hours are flexible, there are many options for research, and the work environment is generally supportive for graduate students.
cons: Some of the downsides of being a graduate student are low pay and potentially long hours.  Long hours are typical for graduate students.

review_title: Really great experience working with some personable professors
job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Associate in Columbus, OH
pros: All the Undergraduate Teaching Associates are really friendly and understanding of your time constraints. Professors are there to help not only the students but the TA's as well
cons: A lot of mandatory training but it helps in the end

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Columbus, OH

pros: Opportunity to work with passionate faculty and staff who care about education, research, and helping both undergraduate and graduate students thrive.

review_title: Decent Benefits, hard to get raises
job_title: Front End Web Developer in Columbus, OH
pros: If you are happy with your salary you can stay there a long time and get pretty good insurance and retirement
cons: You will likely have to switch departments or leave the university and come back in order to get any type of pay increase aside from a cost of living increase

review_title: Many smaller departments but there is a lack of communication
pros:
Great big body that supports a large student population
There are many talented individuals
cons: Not everything moves as fast being a University campus, there are people from many different backgrounds however there are also promises and big plans and projects that start of as quick as they end.

review_title: Its a nice working place but it is extremely competitive to survive here
pros: Good research facilities, Good working environment
cons: They offer lowest salaries, even a fresh graduate earns more than a postdoc.

review_title: Great people the work with and a very friendly and helpful work environment
job_title: Intern At the McCracken Power Plant in Columbus, OH
pros: Easy to go to classes then right to work, flexible hours, friendly coworkers, working for a very reputable institution
cons: The pay isn't great, sometimes it is difficult to balance being a student and working for the University at the same time

review_title: Positive experience with numerous opportunities to expand my technical skill set.
pros: Numerous research projects with varied application and opportunity to be part of interesting projects. Access to numerous resources for research and the environment helps one learn many new skills. Great experience working with everyone.
cons: Not any significant cons with respect to my experience

review_title: A great place to work and study at!
pros: Nice people, nice building, advanced equipment, a great place for a graduate student to learn and practice.
cons: The health insurance in Wooster is not as good as in the main campus Columbus. You have to travel there for lower price.

job_title: Graduate Research Associate in Columbus, OH
pros: Very department based. I enjoy being a graduate student/research associate in my particular department but I really can't speak to what it would be like in other departments.
cons: The graduate community is fine but the undergraduate community is underwhelming in their academic abilities and a bit too sports obsessed for my liking.

review_title: benefits are great but thats about it
pros: benefits are really great and has a lot of other perks to come with working at a university
cons: you have to pay to park here which really sucks. no easy ladder to climb, it's almost encouraged to continuously apply to other jobs within OSU just for a promotion/salary increase.

pros: Good work environment. Amazing staff and wonderful co-workers.  Reasonable hours, very understanding about schedule.
cons: Most of the work is outdoors so very dependent on weather. This job can have intensive labor on the occasion.

review_title: Good opportunity if you don't burnout first.
pros: Fun events with high-level campus constituents.
cons: Not getting reimbursed for miles on personal vehicle, most of the time.  Lots of wear and tear on vehicle by loading event supplies in and out of my vehicle.

review_title: Flexibility is great but the pay, no so much
pros: The higher-ups were for the most part great, and schedule flexibility was great.
cons: Pay wasn't great as an off-campus student trying to make ends meet, and there were never any open shifts because they'd constantly (and unnecessarily) be hiring new people

review_title: Truly an awesome place to work!
job_title: Student Life Student Employee in Columbus, OH
pros: Great place to form connections with professional staff that could help you grow professionally. Working for Student Life also gets you engaged with university events and communities, which is great if you life off campus.
cons: Can't think of any cons to be honest.

pros: This was a flexible job that allowed a student to grow within the business. The staff and peers are great and it is a fun job to have as a student.
cons: There are times in the day where there are huge rushes and it can get overwhelming at times.

review_title: OSU - If only office staff could be appreciated like Buckeyes!
pros: Benefits- paid tuition for employee, 1/2 tuition for child after 3 yrs of employment
